title: Internal compiler error

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Seen on both 1.0 and nightly. Code: http://is.gd/l8z08m

``` rust
fn main() {
    let v = vec![1, 2, 3, 4];
    let vv : Vec<Vec<i32>> = v.splitn(2, |_| { false }).map(|i| { i.to_vec() as Vec<i32> }).collect();
    println!("{:?}", vv);
}
```

Stack trace:

```
error: internal compiler error: translating unsupported cast: collections::vec::Vec<i32> (cast_other) -> collections::vec::Vec<i32> (cast_other)
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
```
